item.title: Genetic Algorithm
item.description: Node Arrangement: Random Nodes Circular Nodes Number of Nodes (Recommended: 2 - 1000): Population Size (Recommend: 10 - 500): Generations (Recommend: 100 - 5,000): Mutation Rate (Recommend: 0.01 - 0.5): Run Pause Restart Introduction to Genetic Algorithm Genetic Algorithms (GA) is first proposed by John Holland in 1975, is a metaheuristic inspired by the process of natural selection in biology and belongs to a large class of algorithms known as evolutionary algorithms (EA) (Holland, 1975). The algorithm mimics the process of nature selection, fitness, offspring production, and mutation. With repetition in these process over many generations, we will eventually arrive at a solution that is better and better overtime.
